headline: Apple reportedly eyes a budget laptop, Denny's to go private
summary: Some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Tuesday, Nov. 4, include: Apple (AAPL) is preparing to launch a low-cost Mac laptop next year, according to a report from Bloomberg. Papa John's (PZZA) shares are falling following a Reuters report that Apollo Global has pulled its offer to take the pizza chain private. Shares of Denny's (DENN) are soaring after agreeing to go private. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination. Editor's note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

content.title: Apple reportedly eyes a budget laptop, Denny's to go private
content.description:
Some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Tuesday, Nov. 4, include:

Apple (AAPL) is preparing to launch a low-cost Mac laptop next year, according to a report from Bloomberg.

Papa John's (PZZA) shares are falling following a Reuters report that Apollo Global has pulled its offer to take the pizza chain private.

Shares of Denny's (DENN) are soaring after agreeing to go private.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

Editor's note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

headline: Skyworks forecasts upbeat quarterly results on robust mobile chip demand
summary: Skyworks Solutions forecast first-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, signaling robust demand for its radio-frequency chips used in Apple's latest 5G iPhones. The rapid adoption of 5G smartphones and launch of AI-enabled phones has benefited Skyworks, which is a key provider of radio-frequency chips for 5G. It is also a major beneficiary of Apple's annual iPhone launch. Last month, Apple forecast holiday-quarter iPhone sales and overall revenue that surpassed Wall Street expectations, powered by orders for iPhone 17 models that the company is racing to fulfill amid continuing supply constraints.

content.title: Skyworks forecasts upbeat quarterly results on robust mobile chip demand
content.summary: Skyworks Solutions forecast first-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, signaling robust demand for its radio-frequency chips used in Apple's latest 5G iPhones. The rapid adoption of 5G smartphones and launch of AI-enabled phones has benefited Skyworks, which is a key provider of radio-frequency chips for 5G. It is also a major beneficiary of Apple's annual iPhone launch. Last month, Apple forecast holiday-quarter iPhone sales and overall revenue that surpassed Wall Street expectations, powered by orders for iPhone 17 models that the company is racing to fulfill amid continuing supply constraints.

headline: Sequoia Capital Leader Exits in VC Shake-Up
summary: Marquee venture-capital firm Sequoia Capital is replacing its top leader,  Roelof Botha,  in one of the biggest shake-ups in the world of Silicon Valley investing.  Botha, 52, was asked to step aside after some Sequoia partners raised concerns about his leadership style, people familiar with the matter said.  The firm’s leaders, including Botha, recently elected his successors.

Botha, 52, was asked to step aside after some Sequoia partners raised concerns about his leadership style, people familiar with the matter said.  The firm’s leaders, including Botha, recently elected his successors.

headline: This Big Short Investor Is Betting Against AI. Is He Making a Big Mistake?
summary: The quote, attributed to legendary economist John Maynard Keynes, isn’t likely to be put to the test by Michael Burry, the famed investor who correctly bet against the housing market in 2006, but it’s still worth exploring.  Burry’s wagers against two of the market’s iconic artificial intelligence stocks—  Nvidia  and  Palantir  —were unveiled in a Securities and Exchange Commission filing published late Monday.  “When I hear short sellers trying to call the AI revolution into question it’s super triggering,”  Palantir  CEO Alex Karp told CNBC on Tuesday as his stock slumped 7% on Tuesday despite a blowout set of third quarter earnings last night.

content.title: This Big Short Investor Is Betting Against AI. Is He Making a Big Mistake?
content.summary: The quote, attributed to legendary economist John Maynard Keynes, isn’t likely to be put to the test by Michael Burry, the famed investor who correctly bet against the housing market in 2006, but it’s still worth exploring.  Burry’s wagers against two of the market’s iconic artificial intelligence stocks—  Nvidia  and  Palantir  —were unveiled in a Securities and Exchange Commission filing published late Monday.  “When I hear short sellers trying to call the AI revolution into question it’s super triggering,”  Palantir  CEO Alex Karp told CNBC on Tuesday as his stock slumped 7% on Tuesday despite a blowout set of third quarter earnings last night.

headline: Tech Stocks Are Behind the S&P’s Swings
summary: Tuesday’s slump highlights how much a handful of megacap tech companies have helped swing markets. The S&P 500 is up 1.7% over the past 10 days, while the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF, which tracks Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia and Tesla, has gained 5.

headline: Trump administration and private investors sign off on $1.4 billion deal with rare earth startups
summary: The Trump administration and private investors are partnering with two rare earth startups in a $1.4 billion deal to scale up the nation's access to materials and technology that is crucial for producing an array of high-tech goods and military equipment.  The investment in Vulcan Elements and ReElement Technologies is the latest stake taken by the U.S. in a handful of private companies — including another rare earths company and chipmaker Intel — since President Donald Trump began his second term in January.  The White House has made it a priority to bolster the nation's supply chain in a market dominated by China.

content.title: Trump administration and private investors sign off on $1.4 billion deal with rare earth startups
content.summary: The Trump administration and private investors are partnering with two rare earth startups in a $1.4 billion deal to scale up the nation's access to materials and technology that is crucial for producing an array of high-tech goods and military equipment.  The investment in Vulcan Elements and ReElement Technologies is the latest stake taken by the U.S. in a handful of private companies — including another rare earths company and chipmaker Intel — since President Donald Trump began his second term in January.  The White House has made it a priority to bolster the nation's supply chain in a market dominated by China.

headline: Apple to enter low-cost laptop market with budget Mac, Bloomberg News reports
summary: The device, aimed to lure customers away from Google's Chromebooks and entry-level Windows PCs, is made for students, businesses and casual users who primarily browse the web, work on documents or conduct light media editing, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.  Apple is also targeting would-be iPad buyers who might prefer a traditional laptop instead.  It is currently in active testing at Apple and in early production with overseas suppliers.

content.title: Apple to enter low-cost laptop market with budget Mac, Bloomberg News reports
content.summary: The device, aimed to lure customers away from Google's Chromebooks and entry-level Windows PCs, is made for students, businesses and casual users who primarily browse the web, work on documents or conduct light media editing, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.  Apple is also targeting would-be iPad buyers who might prefer a traditional laptop instead.  It is currently in active testing at Apple and in early production with overseas suppliers.

headline: CDW beats quarterly profit estimates on strong demand for its IT solutions
summary: IT solutions provider CDW beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Tuesday, as enterprise customers increased tech budgets and embraced artificial intelligence cloud adoption. Growing demand for AI-related cloud and infrastructure to support intensive computing has boosted the need for CDW's IT solutions, which include hardware, software and services for sectors like healthcare, government and education. CDW's chief financial officer, Albert Miralles, said strong performance in services and cloud was a key driver of growth and margins in the quarter.

content.title: CDW beats quarterly profit estimates on strong demand for its IT solutions
content.summary: IT solutions provider CDW beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Tuesday, as enterprise customers increased tech budgets and embraced artificial intelligence cloud adoption. Growing demand for AI-related cloud and infrastructure to support intensive computing has boosted the need for CDW's IT solutions, which include hardware, software and services for sectors like healthcare, government and education. CDW's chief financial officer, Albert Miralles, said strong performance in services and cloud was a key driver of growth and margins in the quarter.

headline: DNSFilter Expands Global Reach through Strategic Partnership with Midis Group to Enhance Cybersecurity Solutions
summary: DNSFilter, a global leader in protective DNS and content filtering, announced today a strategic partnership with Midis Group to provide enhanced cybersecurity solutions to customers across Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa. This partnership will empower organizations in these regions to safeguard their networks against evolving online threats through a cutting-edge, cloud-based platform known for its real-time threat detection and intuitive management.

content.title: DNSFilter Expands Global Reach through Strategic Partnership with Midis Group to Enhance Cybersecurity Solutions
content.summary: DNSFilter, a global leader in protective DNS and content filtering, announced today a strategic partnership with Midis Group to provide enhanced cybersecurity solutions to customers across Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa. This partnership will empower organizations in these regions to safeguard their networks against evolving online threats through a cutting-edge, cloud-based platform known for its real-time threat detection and intuitive management.

headline: Most Trump Ballroom Donors Have Federal Contracts, Watchdog Says
summary: Sixteen of the 24 donors have received federal contracts with the cumulative sum totaling $279 billion over the past five years, according to the study by Public Citizen.  The majority of those awards have gone to defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp., which has been awarded $191 billion in federal contracts during that period, according to the group founded by liberal activist Ralph Nader.

content.title: Most Trump Ballroom Donors Have Federal Contracts, Watchdog Says
content.summary: Sixteen of the 24 donors have received federal contracts with the cumulative sum totaling $279 billion over the past five years, according to the study by Public Citizen.  The majority of those awards have gone to defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp., which has been awarded $191 billion in federal contracts during that period, according to the group founded by liberal activist Ralph Nader.
